reference.shortdesc: The glossSurfaceForm element specifies an unambiguous presentation of the glossterm that may combine multiple forms. The surface form is suitable to introduce the term in new contexts.

section.p: The glossSurfaceForm element is most often used for terms that also specify the glossAcronym element. In that context, the glossSurfaceForm element contains the term in a manner that introduces both the term and the acronym, so that later references to the term can be replaced with the acronym alone. See the abbreviated-form element for a full description of how the surface form is used together with acronyms.

example.title: Example
example.p: This glossentry topic defines "Anti-lock Braking System (ABS)" provides an unambiguous way to render the primary term "Anti-lock Braking System". The abbreviated-form explains how the glossSurfaceForm element affects references to this topic.
